result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 2, Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

- Full time work, school or a combination.
- Obtain a GED/HSED/High School diploma.

- No use of possession of firearms.
- No contact with victim. 
- Court will no violent contact once defendant has started batters intervention course.

- Complete a batters intervention program at the Alma Center.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Any treatment recommended by the agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2, Huber Privileges.  

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1, Huber Privileges.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Report for probation by 5pm on 10/3/2022.
- Complete a batters intervention program at the Alma Center.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Any treatment recommended by the agent.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- Obtain a GED/HSED/High School diploma.
- No contact with victim. 
- Court will no violent contact once defendant has started batters intervention course.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 9/28/22 at 9:00 am in Branch 41.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Defense's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions

Defendant Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow in court with attorney JB Bastien for  Ruby De Leon.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery but not an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Deon'Andre Whitelow appeared by video means with Attorney.  Pursuant to Misdemeanor Division Directive 99-01, defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
